Task.Text: Hello! Welcome to the Leaping Carnival! In this game you will play the role of the owner of a traveilng carnival!
Would you like to see the tutorial?

Choice.Text: Great! Let's get started.
Here is the map. You can travel to various cities, bringing amusement to them and profit to you.
The year is 1930 and the economy is in trouble. People need some escape from their own hardships and that is where you come in!
You have been given a season to make a name for yourself in the carnival business.
Select a town to gather some info about it and click ‘travel’ to head out!
This is your carnival. As the owner, your day will be filled with various tasks that need completing, from attracting customers to tidying up the attractions.
However, you only have 10 hours of operation to complete tasks in! When there is a task that needs doing, an icon will appear over that section of the carnival.
Select that quadrant to determine what needs doing and an estimate on how long it will take.
At the end of the day, you will receive a report for the expenses and profits of the day.
Your employees require compensation and will individually generate profit for you each day.
Additionally, the carnival does require overall maintenance that changes from day to day.
If you feel an employee is doing nothing but burning a hole in your pocket, you can use this screen to fire an employee by clicking the red x and confirming the fire.
Every day, you can hire local workers to come work for your carnival. Click the ‘hire’ button at the top to see who is available and a brief rundown of their capabilities.
Well that's it for the tutorial. Best of luck in managing your carnival!
Alright, best of luck to ya!

Task.Text: Hey Boss! Look at this mud on my shoe! Now how are supposed to expect crowds if you have so many beefs?
Beefs?! What beefs, the season hasn’t even started yet!
Yea, but the coyboys have started entering and ruining this place up!
These cowboys came riding in with bats and started knocking off the ears of the rabbit on the carousel.

Choice.Text: I’ll go see if I can do a quick fix.
How do you think you are going to do that with solid wood?
I don’t know yet. Let me go take a look at it and see what I can do.
A little while later...
Ok so I can’t fix this one. Looks like we’ll have to replace it.
How about those new fancy metal ones?
How in the world are we going to afford that? The season hasn’t even started yet. I’ll have to go look for an older down at Joe’s place.
A few hours later...
Well they didn’t have any rabbits, but they had a couple of frogs that we could use to replace them.
Frogs gross, who in their right mind would want to ride a frog?
Its what they had, that we could afford. Besides, Mary likes frogs, why wouldn’t other children? Now go fetch a few guys to help me put these things on.
Mary is a freak, so I do not think kids will follow her, but if you're lost.
